reviews.review_msg: The best HSCI professor I had! Ryan is very caring, always open for questions and patient with students. Lectures are very clear and easily readable. If you attend his lectures you will do well in his course. There's only two problem sets which are similar to examples given during lectures. His lectures made me change my view on health research.

Ryan is so so so nice, he's trying his best to make sure we understand the contents. I had never attended his office hours but he is always accessible and replies to students very fast. The course is not hard overall but has a lot to learn. He puts a lot of effort into his slides. Try to attend all the lectures as it's easier to catch up.

Ryan is an amazing professor who doesn't get much credit. You can tell that he really cares about the course and wants you to do well. He is very easy to contact and has extra office hours during finals. His lectures may be a bit heavy but very easy to understand. Put in some effort and you can easily get an A in this class.

I am just studying for the final, and while going through his slides I realize how much effort he puts into them. Professor Woods is so wholesome and caring and he clearly cares a lot about his students. He helps as much as he can and not once had I experienced him having a bad tone. His slides, quizzes, tests, assignments are insightful and fair!

Ryan is a very caring professor, he wants his students to succeed. He communicates well and accommodates with his students. His grading criteria is very clear, and he supplies all the resources you need in order to do well in the course. You can tell he is passionate about what he does as it makes class more engaging despite its long duration.
A sweetheart, is very passionate about what he teaches and tries accommodating everyones need. Lectures can get boring but not a hard class to keep up with

Recommended taking HSCI 230 with him. Although his lecture is a bit too long, he tries to explain things as clearly as he can so students can understand them easily. He is also caring and friendly to talk to and is willing to provide help when you are struggling with course materials. If you have a chance to talk course with him, take it for sure!!

Ryan is such a great prof, and I would 100% recommend taking hsci230 with him. He explains concepts really well and is always available to help if something is unclear. He wants his students to succeed and is so helpful, and the quizzes/assignments are fair, and similar to what he asks on tests
Insufferable. SFU seriously needs to evaluate their teachers and TA's because this girl needs to be fired.   RUN so far away from this class!

NO!! WHAT THE ACTUAL HECK. I DONT EVEN KNOW WHAT TO SAY ABOUT HER ANYMORE, LIKE CAN YOU ACTUALLY GIVE SOME GRADES?AND  HOW ARE YOU ABOVE THE PROF, YOU DONT GET TO TEACH THE PROF! CAN YOU JUST LET PEOPLE BE. THE WORLD DOESN'T REVOLVE AROUND YOU. I FELT SUFFOCATED IN THAT CLASS, NOT EVERYONE IS MADE FOR HOW YOU MADE THINGS IN CLASS,
My Shayla!!!

She is overly hard in grading, she will on average mark harder than the rest of the TA's so pray she isn't yours. She gives feedback, then decides to take off marks for doing what she asked for whatever reason.

Had her as a TA for another class and found out that she had also taught this course. She was nice but is incredibly harsh and incoherent in her feedback. Super nitpicky with citations to the point where SHE wrote one of my citations to show me how she wanted them, and then MARKED IT WRONG.
Very unclear criteria, slides are just long paragraphs and goes off on tangents for no reasons. Overall is a headache of a class

Whitney was a TA and she ended up teaching 50% of the class. Her and the professor relied on each other too much and both were disoriented which made us even more confused. Lecture slides are way too wordy and super hard to understand when it comes to definitions. Do not take this class with her if you aren't willing to waste 3 hours on 30 slides.

mahado (the other TA) left when she started lecturing, it's a sign to avoid this course when you're taking it with her, also change up your playlist please i don't wanna listen to the same song every single time i walk into the lecture hall - i'm not a main character that has their own theme song
justice for mahado
she put on spooky scary skeletons right before a midterm exam and that made me lose focus, who does that?? also i hated her spider costume bc i am TERRIFIED of spiders :(
how does one have a phd in this topic but cant teach anything at all? i think she needs to get a phd in education because theres no way i deserved what i got on the case study final assignment
Whitney....

as the other reviews have pointed out, she marks relatively hard. why do i lose marks on the case study questions that have strict word limits and my answers aren't detailed enough? girl i am not a psychic how am i supposed to know what additional stuff you're looking for in the question when it doesn't ask for additional stuff? my mental is boomed

nitpicky when marking  things that weren't in criteria or mentioned even when asked outside of lecture time. but i still managed to earn full marks on most things by trying to ‚Äúguess‚Äù what additional parts she'd want. But at the end she was just really rude and extremely nitpicky. dropped everyone's grades. switch up was insane and never replies.

Whitney dear, just because you did not go to the sweat tour, does NOT mean you have to grade and scale everyone down. This class was not hard at all; it was easy until she decided to nit pick assignments to bring a students mark down.
She literally marks so hard. Scaled everyone down to drop class average. Makes rude comments for assignment feedback. Wasn't fair at all.
Harsh marker, and doesnt make the criteria that clear. when u do follow the assignment criteria, still gives you a pretty bad grade and comments additional stuff.
bruh she made this course so much worse. like can you just make your marking criteria clear. lectures were so boring. she only read off the slides and would get sidetracked so fast
Exams are very fair. But cannnot lecture for without at least 20 "umms" or "uhhs".

Review of HSCI 130. Content OK, but lecture slides are packed with so much information and reading the textbook not helpful. Cumulative group project stretching until end of semester, but groups are assigned random. Group project almost worth the same as three exams. Exams are fair.
A very nice and cool Professor. Only 2 paper and 2 presentations. And the readings are very interesting. Also go to her OH. It really helps.

WHITNEY's exams are fair. There is a cumulative case study project throughout the semester composed of presentations and written assignments. Slides are provided, so the textbook is optional. Although some lecture points may seem contradictory, WHITNEY clarifies any confusion through office hours or email

Simple concepts taught in HSCI 130 were taught in overly complicated and confusing ways, along with many group assignments not always for credit. Random groups for term-long group assignment that includes presentations and written responses. Slides were confusing to learn from, and lectures didn't really help either. Fair exams though.

Simple concepts are dragged on for so long and constantly interrupted by group activities. Grading is tough despite little to no specifics in the criteria. The slides are difficult to use and learn from. Despite her reading off the slides, her lecturing is full of filler words, making it hard to understand. Fair exams, no idea how to prep.

Exams are fair but I dislike the course because simple concepts are over complicated and the slides are impossible to take notes on. Groups are also randomly assigned, so good luck with that. And also, the textbook sucks. I read some pages of it and it still didn't help with my understanding. It actually contradicted what was gone over in lecture.

Recently changed the grading scheme so that majority of your grade comes from group projects so your grade mostly depends on your group :/. Travis does rely way too much on the TAS especially Whitney and it gets weird and obnoxious. The case assignment is marked pretty tough so make sure to get feedback for every single part. Lectures are useless

not everyone can do well in group projects, my group sucked, and i couldn't do anything
! entire semester was the same group and so many assignments , anyway, AND WHITNEY!! lets not go they, i dont even wanna talk about it, but please get rid of whitney travis

i was suffocated in that class, lets understand this tht not evrybdy social every student has their way of learning,understanding,studying, and performing. i have so much and no more words to say for that class at the same time. TRAVIS IS GOOD, and i feel bad for him.1.mostly because of WHITNEY, and 2nd. he needs to plan and tell people what to do

the only thing i didn't like about his class was WHITNEY!  she wouldn't let him speak , he is the prof! and if you get whitney as your TA, get ready to lose mark in everything and literally anything!! and she is very biased, and why does this matter? because travis only listens to her, like why are you even the prof then.

Travis is definitely a nice guy and is clearly passionate about what he teaches. Lectures are almost pointless and for a three-hour time-slot you aren't learning much. Criteria for the group project is vague, while feedback is ambiguous at best and contradictory at worst. Overall, this isn't a must avoid prof., but be prepared for some headaches.

He's a decent prof. Few things to note:
- lecture slides have nothing on them so you need to take good notes
- the marking for the group project felt random and was hard but because the exams were easy it didn't make a huge difference
- exams were very short and easy (if you took notes)
- we did activities in lecture that were sometimes unnecessary
travis is okay

Travis was excellent in my opinion, the only thing that prevents him from getting a five is that he relies too much on the TA in his lectures. I feel that if he was the only one doing the lectures then it would've been a 5/5 professor. Groupwork grading was unnecessarily tough and discouraged a lot of students. Travis is excellent, TAs not so much

I disagree with the comment about ta making marks better. I went to TA and prof multiple times they usually rambled about possibilities without giving any proper explanation or help. no matter how we tried to then explain what we talked about it was never good enough. Or just overall wrong. Would've been nice to learn what was expected of us.

Other than his horrible blank and confusing lecture slides he is a solid professor. Everyone got bad marks on the final assignment, it was his way of "scaling" the class down. For group project assignment always go to T.A. ask for help, it will help your grade

Travis could have been a good professor on his own, relied too much on Whitney (TA) and made lectures difficult to understand. Uncoordinated and asks for options while teaching. You're the Prof, you should know how to lecture without asking for validity. 3 hour lecture: 1 hour of teaching, 1 hour of rambling, and 1 hour of useless presentations.

one of the things that messed up this course was not being able to choose your own groups. also, it's very hard to tell who's the actual prof at times because he relies heavily on TAs to teach the content instead. i walked out of every class feeling like ive learnt nothing from this course, i literally learned more at home. this course is cooked

bro whats the point in doing peer evaluation if you make us submit it as a group üëé barely acted as the prof for this class. idk what we did half the time since lectures were only 1 hour and classes supposed to be 3. also you cant pick your own groups for this stupid project. marking criteria unclear: you want more detail even with a word limit????
Im sure if he actually taught more of the class and spent less time on confusing activities it would be a much better class

Like this class could be so easy if we were actually taught something. Nothing was taught. Absolutely nothing. No one had a clue about anything and the exam policy is actually dumb like how has it taken this long to reconsider that policy? Class time wasted and final assignments and exams were just graded to drop your mark and ruin your efforts.

he barely taught this class, relied on the tas like 80% of the time. it was frustrating since we had no direction in this course. the criteria for assignments isn't clear since we get deducted for things not even mentioned there. barely any exam prep. these lectures also drag on for so long

I loved Beyonce so much, I had all her merch. I'd pray to Beyonce every night before I go to bed, thanking for the life I've been given. "Beyonce is love", I would say, "Beyonce is life". The people in this class hear me and think I'm delusional. But I know they're just jealous of my devotion for Beyonce.
Great prof

i currently have no idea what to study as lately i dont think i or anyone has really been gaining from his lectures. the ratios and questions i just need a clearer understanding of and theres not much time to as the midterm is already around the corner and he wont be there next week class, which is the last class before the midterm.

His lectures were quite heavy and he expected us to know many concepts and terminology already so he went through it pretty quickly. Group assignments and projects were based on lectures and worth 50% of your grade. The assignments were marked pretty tough and the feedback was confusing. Overall not a bad class if you really put in more effort

This professor was okay. The worst was that the assignments were marked very tough and the comments did not even make sense. You can take HSCI 230 with this professor as he is great at teaching and his lectures are amazing, but make sure you do really good on the assignments otherwise, your grades will drop as he is a tough grader.
he is so caring and kind, he does a lot of in class activities and there is no final, just a final project. all exams are on canvas and really fair. stan beyonce!
Best prof at sfu, definitly reccomend taking courses with him. explains course content amazingly. Exams are really fair and exactly what he covers. he gives lots of hints. He's honestly the best!!!
Best professor at SFU. Wants to make sure his students succeed and never complicates things. Take this class with him if you can it will be a wonderful experience.
Travis is a sweetheart and very considerate students and their well-being. An immaculate teacher! Will for sure take any future courses with him.
Caring and understanding of all/diverse students. Travis is the epitome of a GOOD professor.
Travis is a great professor! he is so helpful in office hours and cares about his students.

Dr. Salway is an incredibly kind professor who genuinely cares about the content in the course. He sent out feedback surveys 4 times during the course to see how he could improve his teaching style to fit the needs of the class. If you have any interest in social epi, or just want a nice professor, take a class with Travis.

Travis is a really caring and kind professor but his grading scale is inflexible where an 89 is considered an A-. Although he makes lectures engaging, the material he explains can almost always be explained in a couple slides. He also tends to assume the class is already aware of all terminology which is a bit harsh for a 200-level class.

3 hour lectures aren't very exciting but Travis makes sure to add really helpful in class activities to keep the class awake and engaged. The exam and assignments are quite fair. There is a lot practice questions in textbook that are very similar to the exam questions which helped a lot. He's a great prof and really cares about his students.

Travis represents educators who genuinely care about future professionals and the future of healthcare. He is a fair grader, and gives visual/interactive examples (i.e. mock studies) in his teaching to help clarify concepts. He definitely wants students to succeed and explains things in such a comprehensive manner!

Travis is probably the best professor I've ever had. He completely reinstated in me the reasons in which I applied to Health Sciences at SFU. He is not just highly accomplished in his field and deeply knowledgeable, but he is compassionate, funny, considerate, and he genuinely creates a safe environment for all his students to learn. LOVE Travis!
Amazing. He makes sure you understand the stuff and lectures are awesome.
